title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0061

segments.en: A nice summertime lesson for everyone.
segments.cn: 这是一个适合大家的夏季课程。

segments.en: So we're gonna be talking about swimming and, well, it's a very popular sport, right?
segments.cn: 所以我们要谈谈游泳，这是一项非常受欢迎的运动，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, so this is another lesson in our sports series.
segments.cn: 是的，这是我们体育系列的另一节课。

segments.en: So why don't we preview some of the language we'll find in the dialogue.
segments.cn: 那我们先预览一下对话中会出现的一些语言。

segments.en: Alright, we have two words to look at here.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们这里有两个词。

segments.en: Well, this is the verb to sail, right?
So sailing is travelling in a boat.
segments.cn: 所以航行是指在船上旅行。

segments.en: In a boat with no engine.
Right, so you must use the wind to push you forward.
segments.cn: 对，所以你必须利用风来推动你前进。

segments.en: Now let's take a look at our other word.
segments.cn: 现在我们来看另一个词。

segments.en: But you don't pronounce the CH as you normally would, right?
segments.cn: 但你不按通常的方式发音CH，对吧？

segments.en: Another one of these really difficult to spell English words.
segments.cn: 这是另一个拼写非常困难的英语单词。

segments.en: Right, so you don't say anchor, you would say anchor.
So the anchor is a verb and a noun.
segments.cn: 所以锚既是动词也是名词。

segments.en: Well, when anchor is used as a noun, it means the hook that you throw over the boat into the water and it keeps you staying in the same place.
segments.cn: 当锚作为名词使用时，指的是你扔到水里的钩子，它能让你停留在同一个地方。

segments.en: Okay, but the verb to anchor.
So you, so to throw the anchor into the water, you would just say to anchor the boat.
segments.cn: 所以你要把锚扔进水里，你可以说“锚定船只”。

segments.en: To keep it in the same place.
segments.cn: 让它停留在同一个地方。

segments.en: Okay, great words related to sailing.
segments.cn: 好的，和航行相关的好词。

segments.en: But now, let's listen to her dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 现在，让我们第一次听她的对话。

segments.en: Well, we've got two friends here who are sailing in their boat and they decide to take a swim.
segments.cn: 嗯，我们有两个朋友在他们的船上航行，他们决定去游泳。
嗯，让我们看看发生了什么。

segments.en: This is such a beautiful day.
segments.cn: 今天真是个美丽的日子。

segments.en: Anchor the boat for a little while.
I taught you how to swim.
The shark is coming straight towards me.
All right, so a shark attack.
I know, this is my worst fear when swimming.
segments.cn: 我知道，这就是我游泳时最害怕的事情。

segments.en: Well, also in the lake, but... No sharks in lakes.
segments.cn: 嗯，也在湖里，但……湖里没有鲨鱼。

segments.en: I know, but I'm still afraid of them.
segments.cn: 我知道，但我还是害怕它们。

segments.en: All right, so don't worry about it.
I'm sure the girl is okay.
Yeah, or maybe she's gonna punch the shark in the face and she'll escape.
segments.cn: 是的，或者也许她会一拳打在鲨鱼脸上，然后逃脱。

segments.en: Okay, let's take a look at some of the words that we saw in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们看看我们在语言总结中看到的一些词。

segments.en: We have three excellent swimming words for you.
segments.cn: 我们为你准备了三个优秀的游泳词。

segments.en: The first one is doggy paddling.
It's not really a proper way of swimming, right?
segments.cn: 这并不是一种真正的游泳方式，对吧？

segments.en: No, you don't see this in the Olympics.
segments.cn: 不，你在奥运会上看不到这个。

segments.en: Right, you're sort of moving your hands quickly in front of you.
segments.cn: 对，你的手在你面前快速移动。

segments.en: And your legs are all over the place.
And you're basically not really swimming, you're just trying to stay afloat.
segments.cn: 你基本上并不是在游泳，只是在努力保持漂浮。

segments.en: Again, this can be a noun or a verb.
segments.cn: 再次，这可以是名词或动词。

segments.en: This swimming style or doggy paddling.
segments.cn: 这种游泳风格或狗狗划水。

segments.en: All right, let's take a look at our second swimming style.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看第二种游泳风格。

segments.en: Well, it's sort of like swimming like a frog.
So you have your legs that are similar to like a frog, right?
segments.cn: 所以你的腿像青蛙一样，对吧？

segments.en: And what are your hands doing?
Your hands are moving in front of you together, then out towards the side.
segments.cn: 你的手在你面前一起移动，然后向两侧伸展。

segments.en: Okay, so you're kind of doing like circles.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以你有点像在画圈。

segments.en: But you get kind of tired when you swim like this, right?
segments.cn: 但是你游泳时会有点累，对吧？

segments.en: Now let's take a look at our third word.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看第三个词。

segments.en: And you're kicking your feet as well.
But what are your hands doing?
All right, if you guys could be here in the studio, you would see Erika doing her backstroke.
segments.cn: 好吧，如果你们能在工作室里，你们会看到Erika在做她的仰泳。

segments.en: Yeah, I'm pretty good at it.
Okay, so let's listen to this dialogue again.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们再听一遍这个对话。

segments.en: And then we'll come back and look at some great phrases.
segments.cn: 然后我们再回来看看一些很棒的短语。

segments.en: This is such a beautiful day.
segments.cn: 今天真是个美丽的日子。

segments.en: Anchor the boat for a little while.
I'm going to take a dip.
I taught you how to swim.
Okay, so we have some really good phrases related to swimming and water.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们有一些与游泳和水相关的很好的短语。

segments.en: Okay, let's take a look at these in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们在流利度构建器中看看这些。

segments.en: So if I say I'm going to take a dip.
segments.cn: 所以如果我说我要去游泳。

segments.en: You're going to have a quick swim.
So you can take a dip in the pool.
segments.cn: 所以你可以在游泳池里去游泳。
甚至在你的浴缸里，对吧？

segments.en: Unless your bathtub is really, really, really big.
segments.cn: 除非你的浴缸真的非常非常大。

segments.en: All right, so not for the bathtub, but for swimming.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以不适合浴缸，但适合游泳。

segments.en: Okay, now let's take a look at our second phrase.
segments.cn: 好的，现在我们来看第二个短语。

segments.en: I probably use it 500 times a day.
Okay, so let's listen to some examples with for a little while, and then we'll come back and explain it.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们来听一些关于“一小会儿”的例子，然后我们再回来解释。

segments.en: I'm just going to sit down for a little while.
It will only hurt for a little while.
Do you want to play tennis for a little while?
segments.cn: 你想打网球一小会儿吗？

segments.en: So it means for a short time.
And you can change it, right?
You can say, oh, I'm going to play for a little while.
segments.cn: 你可以说，哦，我要玩一小会儿。

segments.en: Yeah, or I'm going to sleep for a little while.
segments.cn: 是的，或者我会睡一小会儿。

segments.en: All right, so if learners use this phrase, I find it sounds really, really great, because it's not something that students normally use.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以如果学习者使用这个短语，我觉得听起来真的很好，因为这不是学生通常使用的东西。

segments.en: Yeah, I guess a student wouldn't really use this phrase normally.
segments.cn: 是的，我想学生通常不会用这个短语。

segments.en: Yeah, so guys, use it, because you'll sound awesome.
segments.cn: 是的，所以大家，使用它，因为你会听起来很棒。

segments.en: Yeah, you'll sound really, really fluent.
segments.cn: 是的，你会听起来非常流利。

segments.en: Okay, and let's take a look at our last phrase.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们看看最后一个短语。
好的，所以直的意思是直接。

segments.en: Not going anywhere else, but directly.
segments.cn: 不往其他地方去，而是直接。

segments.en: And towards is in that direction.
So the shark was coming straight towards me, it's coming directly at me.
segments.cn: 所以鲨鱼是直直地朝我来的，直接朝我来。

segments.en: Moving in a line and not moving side to side.
Okay, so can you give me another example of how you would use straight towards?
segments.cn: 好的，你能给我另一个例子，说明你会如何使用“直直地朝向”？

segments.en: Watch out, there's a car coming straight towards you.
segments.cn: 小心，有辆车正直直朝你开来。

segments.en: Yeah, or maybe when I get home from work, I go straight towards the fridge.
segments.cn: 是的，或者也许我下班回家时，我直直朝冰箱走。

segments.en: Okay, so we've looked at a lot of great words, really good phrases.
segments.cn: 好的，我们看了很多很好的词，真的很好的短语。

segments.en: Let's listen to this dialogue one last time, and then we'll come back, and Eric is going to tell us a really great story about boats.
segments.cn: 让我们最后再听一次这个对话，然后我们再回来，Eric会给我们讲一个关于船的很棒的故事。

segments.en: This is such a beautiful day.
Anchor the boat for a little while.
I taught you how to swim.
The shark is coming straight towards me!

All right, well Marco, I was telling you that I used to spend every summer on the lake, and my family had a really small house on a small island, and my cousins had another small house on another small island.
segments.cn: 好吧，Marco，我跟你说过我以前每个夏天都在湖上度过，我的家人在一个小岛上有一栋很小的房子，我的表兄在另一个小岛上有另一栋小房子。

segments.en: So our families are really close, and we used to go to one house for dinner one night and the other house to dinner the next night.
segments.cn: 所以我们的家庭关系非常亲密，我们通常一个晚上去一个房子吃晚餐，第二个晚上去另一个房子吃晚餐。

segments.en: So everyone was over at my cousin's house, except for my grandfather.
segments.cn: 所以大家都在我表兄的家，除了我的祖父。

segments.en: And so he was thinking, okay, it's late.
segments.cn: 所以他在想，好吧，天晚了。

segments.en: Maybe I better go pick up my wife and see what's going on.
segments.cn: 也许我该去接我的妻子，看看发生了什么。

segments.en: So he goes into the boat.
There's no light on the boat.
He's driving straight towards the island, when suddenly my cousin in his boat drives directly into my grandfather.
segments.cn: 他正直直朝岛开去，突然我的表兄的船直接撞上了我的祖父。

segments.en: Two boats crashed in the lake.
Yeah, and then my grandfather's boat flipped over, it turned upside down.
segments.cn: 是的，然后我祖父的船翻了，翻了个身。

segments.en: And he fell in the water.
He was really angry about this.
The boat stayed in the water and the engine fell down to the bottom.
segments.cn: 船留在水里，发动机掉到了底部。

segments.en: So we had to go the next morning to get the boat.
segments.cn: 所以我们第二天早上去取船。

segments.en: And we actually had to hire some scuba divers to go to the bottom of the lake to get the engine.
segments.cn: 我们实际上还雇了一些潜水员去湖底取发动机。

segments.en: I imagine your grandpa was pretty angry.
segments.cn: 我想你爷爷一定很生气。

segments.en: Yeah, he tells the story every year.
segments.cn: 是的，他每年都讲这个故事。

segments.en: I've got a million of these crazy lake stories because my family... It always happens.
segments.cn: 我有一百万个这样的疯狂湖泊故事，因为我的家人……总是发生。

segments.en: Well, do you have any crazy stories or any stories related to boats or to swimming or to shark attacks or shark attacks?
segments.cn: 那么，你们有没有什么疯狂的故事，或者与船、游泳、鲨鱼袭击相关的故事？

segments.en: So come to our website, EnglishPod.com.
Leave your stories, share with us.
segments.cn: 留下你的故事，和我们分享。

segments.en: And also if you have any doubts or questions, Erika and I are always there to answer.
segments.cn: 如果你有任何疑问或问题，Erika和我总是在这里回答。

segments.en: Well, we're out of time for this lesson.
segments.cn: 好吧，这节课的时间到了。
